isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - LIFT AXLE SYSTEMS - SYSTEM DESCRIPTION

svcsubsecinfo.para: This manual covers lift axle systems; including the axle assemblies, the controls and the control lines. The types of lift axles covered are self-steering axles and fixed (non-steering) axles. The lift axles covered may be configured as pusher axles (located ahead of the rear drive axles) or tag axles (located behind the rear drive axles).
Coverage of lift axle components that are covered in existing sections of the Master Service Manual will be referenced in this manual. Those components include:

item.para: Brake Components - refer to GROUP 04 of the Master Service Manual
Steering Components - refer to GROUP 02 of the Master Service Manual
Wheel Hubs - refer to GROUP 02 of the Master Service Manual
